raw_comment: I notice that the US is using less coal than other countries like China. I also notice that wind and solar seem to be making their way into the picture. They started gathering traction around 2010 and now it’s made a decent sized impact with the use of it similar to nuclear. I wonder how long it will take for wind and solar to become very predominate and surpass coal and gas. Will it take 2 or 3 decades? I think the community would do better on a more sustainable form of renewable electricity. If we can see an increase in hydroelectric, wind, and solar, then this will be very beneficial. A catchy headline would be “The generational switch in Electricity, Lump of Coal to Solar and Gold”.
ace_sentences: I notice that the US uses less coal than China.
I notice that wind energy and solar energy are becoming more important.
Wind energy and solar energy started to gain traction around 2010.
Now wind energy and solar energy have a decent-sized impact.
The use of wind energy and solar energy is similar to the use of nuclear energy.
I wonder how long it will take until wind energy and solar energy become predominant.
I wonder how long it will take until wind energy and solar energy surpass coal and gas.
I think that the community would do better with a more sustainable form of renewable electricity.
If hydroelectric power increases, then this will be beneficial.
If wind energy increases, then this will be beneficial.
If solar energy increases, then this will be beneficial.
The headline is: The generational switch in electricity from lump of coal to solar and gold.
